item.title: I have decided to vote ‚ÄòNO‚Äô on any proposed school calendar...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I have decided to vote ‚ÄòNO‚Äô on any proposed school calendar that begins before August 30th.

Many schools lack the proper ventilation and are without air conditioning. Our students and educators deserve better than heat induced classrooms!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today I asked Denver Public Schools to provide the School Board...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today I asked Denver Public Schools to provide the School Board with instructions on how to opt-out of CMAS in multiple languages and ensure families their students would NOT be punished in ANY way for opting-out.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I was in a fifth grade class last week and was asked ‚ÄúWhy do...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I was in a fifth grade class last week and was asked ‚ÄúWhy do you wear a hat?‚Äù

I told them the story and how I use it as my own ‚ÄúSuperman cape.‚Äù

After I had logged off that same student went to grab his own hat and turned it backwards saying, ‚ÄúThis is my Superman cape.‚Äù ‚ù§Ô∏è
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today my community cabinet voted to call on the state...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today my community cabinet voted to call on the state legislature to suspend CMAS for the 2021 school year.

Here is their statement:

item.title: Our students should NOT be forced to come back to schools, turn...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Our students should NOT be forced to come back to schools, turn in their technology, and take standardized tests for the benefit of those at the top.

SIGN THIS PETITION FOR DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS!

Opt Out Denver: DPS Opt Your Students Out of CMAS! (Opten por no a CMAS!)

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Elections are never ending in Denver! We have an election for...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Elections are never ending in Denver!

We have an election for the Denver School Board this November and I am excited to endorse Scott Esserman for Denver School Board At-Large!

Scott is a retired educator and current DPS parent who understands why parents must make tough choices when picking what school is best for their children. As an educator he has dedicated his life to ensuring ALL students have equitable resources and will take that same passion to fighting for our ch...ildren.

Instead of running a campaign of tearing people down, he is busy lifting people up! He is an advocate for educators, students, and community!

I hope you will join me in supporting this champion for educational justice!

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

In acknowledging the difficulty the COVID-19 pandemic continues to present to our school staff, students, and families, the Denver Public Schools‚Äô Board of Education calls on Governor Jared Polis, the State Board of Education, and the Colorado General Assembly to urge the Colorado Commissioner of Education and Department of Education to submit an application to the federal government to waive required standardized assessment.

item.title: Families of Color have been disproportionately impacted by...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Families of Color have been disproportionately impacted by COVID. It only makes sense to vaccinate their educators first.

Such prioritization puts "a focus on our students who need us most," a district official said.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver to prioritize teachers at high-poverty schools for COVID-19 vaccine

Such prioritization puts "a focus on our students who need us most," a district official said.Such prioritization puts "a focus on our students who need us most," a district official said.

item.title: If white students get to opt out of #BlackHistoryMonth then...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

If white students get to opt out of #BlackHistoryMonth then Black students can opt out the other nine months of school.

Y‚Äôall not ready for that conversation though.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I‚Äôm going all in to elect Scott Esserman for Denver School...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I‚Äôm going all in to elect Scott Esserman for Denver School Board At-Large!

He understands the needs and challenges of the Denver Public Schools. Instead of approaching this moment with wanting to discredit the incumbent progressive board and chastising our value to support EVERY student he is working to bridge the divide to ensure everyone has a seat at the table.

I am over the approach to burn things down without a plan to rebuild, so that is why I am supporting Scott to join our school board as a healer and not a divider.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Honored to be nominated and receive the 2021 Juanita R. Gray ‚Äî...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Honored to be nominated and receive the 2021 Juanita R. Gray ‚Äî Community Service Award.

These awards honor African-American men, women and youth who exemplify the ideals and spirit represented by Ms.Gray‚Äôs commitment to the Denver community.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Folks have raised questions about the search firm that we hired...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Folks have raised questions about the search firm that we hired in Denver Public Schools to help us find a new Superintendent. Yes, they have staff that went through a reform-leaning fellowship, but are they actively involved with this organization ... no they are not.

Folks have said that my colleagues and I sold out the community with this choice and that we are breaking the promises we made to community when campaigning for this seat, which is completely false. It comes fr...om a space of privilege when folks judge this firm with less scrutiny than their competitors, but then when called out about the privilege they are exuding they refuse to acknowledge how they are benefiting from a system that has always been built for them.

Instead of making false statements about this School Boards intention, I hope folks will allow this firm to lead and if we fail, then hold us accountable. I am confident and believe that we need to trust women of color and allow them to lead without casting doubt before they even get started something we don‚Äôt often do for white men.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways ‚Äî I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences ‚Äî I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
